lip.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: one of the two soft parts around your mouth where your skin is redder or darker
lip.translation[0].definitions[0].note.t: thin-lipped/thick-lipped/full-lipped (=having lips that are thin, or large and round)
lip.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: She had big eyes and full lips (=large and round lips).
Matt opened the door with a smile on his lips.
Marty kissed me right on the lips!
Stephen pursed his lips with distaste  (=brought them together tightly into a small circle).
lip.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: the edge of a hollow or deep place in the land
lip.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: the old road that ran along the lip of the gorge
lip.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: the edge of something you use to hold or pour liquid
lip.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: talk that is not polite or respectful – used especially by adults to children
lip.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: Don’t give me any of your lip!
